title: Concerns about changes in laws related to work permits2023.09.21:
description:
Starting next week, there will be changes to the law regarding how to obtain a work permit. The amount has increased again this time, and there are concerns that it will affect the operational methods of each ministry's labor bureau.

In most cases, changes to required documents, etc. are made by the labor bureau of each ministry as part of the operation of the law, without changing the law. Therefore, in practice, it often happens that the rules change from today or this week.

Over the past three years, the labor law was significantly revised in February 2021, making it difficult to issue work permits in terms of the law. I hope they don't make it any more strict, but I can't yet predict how much of an impact the legal amendments will have on practice, but please check with your lawyer and let us know if there are any points that might be difficult to implement. Let me introduce you.

title: About business in Vietnam
description:
The photo is of Takashimaya in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ho Chi Minh City, where our company is located, is said to have a population of nearly 10 million people. Although Vietnam is still in the growth process, its large population has gained purchasing power over the past 10 years. The number of Japanese companies entering the Vietnamese market is increasing, and Uniqlo and Muji have also expanded into Ho Chi Minh during the coronavirus pandemic. Sales in Vietnam have yet to become mainstream, but trust in Japanese manufacturers and restaurants is high in Vietnam, and some companies, such as Acecook, which have been in Vietnam for a long time, are already well established. Although our business has been dependent on exports to the United States, the domestic market has continued to grow despite the coronavirus pandemic. Also, since immigration restrictions were lifted, the number of companies aiming to expand into Vietnam has increased again, and now is the time to aim to be local to Vietnam.
